<!-- <UL>
<H2>Some Remarks on Remote Method Invocation RMI</H2>
<BR></UL></P>
<P><UL>
<LI><H2>So good news is that RMI has enabled very active distributed computing research and indeed development  as in JavaSpaces from Sun
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Performance is reasonable but insufficient for some applications
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>It is already good enough to get started and for instance outperforms many (Java) CORBA implementations
</UL></UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Forum suggests (optional) changes in several areas including
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>Serialization -- this is used in Persistent object storage and to transmit objects between different programs in a distributed application -- can be optimized differently for each case
<LI>Transport Layer -- need to be able to layer RMI interfaces over fast transport mechanisms -- Myrinet, native ATM etc.</UL></UL></P>
<P>  -->
</Body>
